alert.note: Alert for Knox; Laurel; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 5:42PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Laurel, northwestern Knox and north central Whitley Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 541 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Vox, or 11 miles southwest of London, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Barton, North Corbin, Dorthae, Lily and Faber around 550 PM EDT. Moore Hill and Woodbine around 555 PM EDT. Wilton, Lynn Camp and McHargue around 600 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Rossland, Bertha Station, Gray, Tuttle, Arkle, Garrich, Indian Creek, Knoxfork, Emmanuel, Lowell, Bentley Station, Dishman Springs, Jarvis, Cranes Nest and Fletcher. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
